intro: Coronidium glutinosum, commonly known as sticky corydalis, is a flowering plant native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its delicate, often pink or purple flowers. The plant produces a sticky substance on its stems and leaves, which gives it its common name. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its botanical features include small, clustered flowers and a rhizomatous root system.
